page.title: 15Franklin Secondary School.
page.content: The Franklin Secondary School is named after Spilsby's most famous son; the discoverer of the North West Passage. The School admitted its first pupils on September 15th. 1953. It was the first three storey school to be built in Lindsey and at that time comprised of assembly hall, dining hall and the present block of practical rooms. The curriculum had a strong bias towards rural studies and the arable section of the School farm covered an area of 2.2 acres. This site is now occupid by the Primary School Annexe. The School hs been much altered and extended since then. The School has always strived for high standards of discipline and courtesy as well as endeavouring to fit the academic needs of the children With the advent of falling rolls further changes are inevitable.
